blocks.name: OPTIONS
blocks.description: Options controlling unsaturated zone flow package behavior and output.

variables.name: AUXILIARY
variables.description: Defines auxiliary variable names to be associated with each UZF cell.
variables.tooltip: One or more names of auxiliary variables read with each UZF entry. Can be used for transport concentrations or user-defined data.

variables.name: BOUNDNAMES
variables.description: Keyword to activate reading of boundary names for each UZF cell.
variables.tooltip: When specified, each UZF entry can include an optional text name for grouping in budget reporting and observations.

variables.name: PRINT_INPUT
variables.description: Keyword to print UZF input data to the listing file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, UZF data is echoed to the listing file for verification.

variables.name: PRINT_FLOWS
variables.description: Keyword to print UZF flow rates to the listing file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, computed UZF flow rates are printed to the listing file for each time step.

variables.name: SAVE_FLOWS
variables.description: Keyword to save UZF flow terms to the cell-by-cell budget file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, UZF flow terms are written to the binary budget file.

variables.name: BUDGET FILEOUT
variables.description: Name of the binary file for writing detailed UZF budget output.
variables.tooltip: Specifies the file name for saving the detailed UZF budget including infiltration, ET, and recharge to the water table.

variables.name: SIMULATE_ET
variables.description: Keyword to simulate evapotranspiration within the unsaturated zone.
variables.tooltip: When specified, ET is simulated as water is removed from the unsaturated zone based on PET, extinction depth, and extinction water content. Requires PET and EXTDP in PERIOD block.

variables.name: LINEAR_GWET
variables.description: Keyword to use a linear function for groundwater ET.
variables.tooltip: When specified, groundwater ET varies linearly between the ET surface and the extinction depth. By default, a square wave function is used.

variables.name: UNSAT_ETWC
variables.description: Keyword to simulate ET from the unsaturated zone using the water content-based approach.
variables.tooltip: When specified, unsaturated zone ET is computed based on the current water content relative to the residual and saturated water contents.

variables.name: UNSAT_ETAE
variables.description: Keyword to simulate ET from the unsaturated zone using the actual evaporation approach.
variables.tooltip: When specified, unsaturated zone ET uses a capillary pressure-based approach with HA, HROOT, and ROOTACT parameters from the PERIOD block.

blocks.name: PACKAGEDATA
blocks.description: Static UZF cell data defining the physical properties of each unsaturated zone cell.

variables.name: IUZNO
variables.description: UZF cell number (sequential, one-based identifier).
variables.tooltip: Unique identifier for each UZF cell, numbered from 1. Used to reference UZF cells in the PERIOD block.

variables.name: CELLID
variables.description: Cell identifier for the UZF cell location in the GWF model.
variables.tooltip: Identifies the groundwater model cell where this UZF cell is located. Recharge from the unsaturated zone enters the groundwater model at this cell.

variables.name: LANDFLAG
variables.description: Flag indicating if the UZF cell is at the land surface (1) or subsurface (0).
variables.tooltip: Set to 1 for the uppermost UZF cell in a column (land surface). Set to 0 for deeper UZF cells. Only land surface cells receive infiltration.

variables.name: IVERTCON
variables.description: UZF cell number of the cell directly below this one in the unsaturated zone column.
variables.tooltip: Defines the vertical connectivity of UZF cells. Set to 0 if this is the bottom UZF cell (directly above the water table). Otherwise, set to the IUZNO of the cell below.

variables.name: SURFDEP
variables.description: Surface depression storage depth, in model length units.
variables.tooltip: Depth of surface depressions that must fill before runoff occurs. Water stored in depressions is available for infiltration and ET. Typical values are 0.01 to 0.1 meters.

variables.name: VKS
variables.description: Saturated vertical hydraulic conductivity of the unsaturated zone, in model length per time units.
variables.tooltip: Maximum infiltration rate and vertical conductivity of the unsaturated zone material. Controls the rate of downward water movement. Typical values depend on soil type.

variables.name: THTR
variables.description: Residual (irreducible) water content of the unsaturated zone, dimensionless.
variables.tooltip: The minimum water content below which drainage by gravity ceases. Represents water held by capillary forces. Typical values: 0.02-0.05 for sand, 0.07-0.15 for clay.

variables.name: THTS
variables.description: Saturated water content of the unsaturated zone, dimensionless.
variables.tooltip: The maximum water content (approximately equal to porosity). Typical values: 0.30-0.45 for sand, 0.38-0.55 for clay.

variables.name: THTI
variables.description: Initial water content of the unsaturated zone, dimensionless.
variables.tooltip: Starting water content at the beginning of the simulation. Must be between THTR and THTS. Affects initial moisture storage and drainage.

variables.name: EPS
variables.description: Brooks-Corey epsilon exponent for the unsaturated zone, dimensionless.
variables.tooltip: Defines the shape of the moisture retention curve. Higher values produce sharper transitions between wet and dry conditions. Typical values: 3.5 for sand, 5.0-8.0 for silt and clay.

blocks.name: PERIOD
blocks.description: Stress period data specifying time-varying UZF boundary conditions.

variables.name: IUZNO
variables.description: UZF cell number for which data is specified.
variables.tooltip: The UZF cell number from PACKAGEDATA. Only land surface cells (LANDFLAG=1) should receive infiltration.

variables.name: FINF
variables.description: Infiltration rate applied to the UZF cell, in units of length per time.
variables.tooltip: Applied infiltration flux at the land surface. Excess infiltration (above VKS) becomes rejected infiltration or runoff. Typically represents net precipitation minus surface runoff.

variables.name: PET
variables.description: Potential evapotranspiration rate, in units of length per time.
variables.tooltip: Maximum possible ET rate. Actual ET depends on water availability and depth below the ET surface. Only used when SIMULATE_ET is active.

variables.name: EXTDP
variables.description: ET extinction depth below the land surface, in model length units.
variables.tooltip: Depth below the land surface at which ET ceases. ET rate decreases with depth from PET at the surface to zero at EXTDP. Only used when SIMULATE_ET is active.

variables.name: EXTWC
variables.description: Extinction water content, dimensionless.
variables.tooltip: Water content below which ET from the unsaturated zone ceases. Must be between THTR and THTS. Only used when UNSAT_ETWC is active.

variables.name: HA
variables.description: Air-entry potential (negative pressure head), in model length units.
variables.tooltip: The capillary pressure at which the soil begins to desaturate. Used with UNSAT_ETAE option for capillary-based ET calculation.

variables.name: HROOT
variables.description: Root potential (negative pressure head), in model length units.
variables.tooltip: The capillary pressure at plant roots. Used with UNSAT_ETAE option. Must be more negative than HA.

variables.name: ROOTACT
variables.description: Root activity function value, dimensionless.
variables.tooltip: Defines the distribution of root activity with depth. Used with UNSAT_ETAE option. Typical values range from 0.0 to 1.0.
